MINUTES OF THE NAEB BOARD MEETING - AMES', IOWA
January 21-23, 1954
Presents Ausmus, Skornia, Fleming,, Miller, Sehooley, Richard, Dunn, Wynn, Hunter.
Richard Goggin, Manager of the St, Louis TV Station;, presented the union
problem which he faces in the St. Louis operation. The issues and problems were
discussed in detail. Sehooley moved that the President and Executive Director
discuss with Morris Norik the course and procedure which would be most helpful
to the ME® <?n a national level, and to individual and local member stations on
a local level. The motion was seconded by Miller and carried.
Agenda for Discussion by the Board?
The Board discussed the engagement of Morris Novik by the JGET on the
labor and union problem, and the relationship of the JCET and the Educational
Television and R&dio Center to the MEB and its member stations on such special
services.
The President announced the grant of $30,000 by the FAE to the NAEB for
the employment of a TV engineering consultant and staff to provide special services
for one years with a request for an extension of the grant for an additional
one year period to be submitted in February by the MEB. Other requests from
the FAE by the NAEB will- be delayed and have to await the allocation of funds
to the FAE by the Ford Foundation. The NAEB should project all request for funds
a year in advance, in order to receive consideration by the Foundation Board
and allow time for action.
Ausmus proposed• that the agenda for discussion be established as follows*
1. the radio tape network? 2. NAEB and Television? 3. HAEB as e. professional
organizations 4- and NAEB relations with other agencies and organizations.
Miller proposed starting discussion with a definition of the nature, function and
purposes of the NAEB, to serve as a point of reference for all actions and decisions
relating to questions and issues.
